todaysEvents.title: Gladinet CentreStack & Triofox RCE vulnerability exploited
todaysEvents.description: Hackers are exploiting an undocumented vulnerability in the cryptographic algorithm implementation within Gladinet's CentreStack and Triofox products for secure remote file access and sharing, leading to RCE attacks.

todaysEvents.title: Yearn Finance smart contract hack and pxETH recovery
todaysEvents.description: Yearn Finance, a defi yield protocol, suffered its third hack due to bugs in its smart contract. The exploiter drained assets from several pools by minting a large number of yETH tokens and withdrawing corresponding assets. $2.4 million in pxETH, a liquid staking token issued by Redacted Cartel, was recovered after Redacted Cartel burned and reissued the stolen tokens.

todaysEvents.title: Atradius & Crédito y Caución client data breach
todaysEvents.description: The attacker reportedly exfiltrated 950,000 records, including client names, mobile numbers, optional emails, policy tiers, and contract types tied to the Atradius and Crédito y Caución divisions.

past7Days.briefing: This week’s cyber threat landscape was highly active and severe, marked by a series of impactful breaches, exploits, and scams across financial, healthcare, insurance, manufacturing, and crypto sectors. Notable events included ransomware attacks exploiting VPN and application vulnerabilities at major banks and NHS, a €700M deepfake-powered scam network dismantled by law enforcement, repeated and escalating hacks against Yearn Finance’s DeFi protocols, and significant data exfiltration from automakers and insurance providers. Attackers leveraged both technical vulnerabilities (such as zero-click exploits and cryptographic flaws) and sophisticated social engineering (including deepfakes and AI chat impersonation). In addition, multiple scam and fraud campaigns targeted popular platforms like Telegram and WeChat, amplifying risk for individual users and organizations alike. The prevalence of high-severity incidents underscores the urgency for enhanced vulnerability management, multi-factor authentication, and proactive monitoring.
past7Days.trends: High-impact ransomware and data breaches continued to target financial, healthcare, and insurance institutions, while DeFi platforms like Yearn Finance faced repeated smart contract hacks. Technical exploits, particularly zero-click and remote code execution vulnerabilities, are on the rise, affecting both legacy and cutting-edge systems (e.g., Gladinet, Oracle EBS, Gemini AI). The week also saw persistent fraud and scam activity across social channels (Telegram, WeChat), with deepfake technology and AI-driven attacks gaining ground. There is a growing pattern of attackers abusing third-party vendors, authentication weaknesses, and social engineering, with notable spikes in exploit disclosures and successful data exfiltration mid-to-late week.
past7Days.predictions: Expect continued and possibly intensified targeting of financial and DeFi platforms, with smart contract bugs and authentication bypasses remaining prime attack vectors (confidence: high). Technical exploits, especially zero-click and remote code execution vulnerabilities, will likely be weaponized further, affecting SaaS, cloud, and AI-powered systems (confidence: medium-high). Social engineering and deepfake scams will persist on major communication channels, posing ongoing fraud risks to both organizations and individuals (confidence: high). The insurance and manufacturing sectors may see follow-on activity as threat actors exploit recent breaches. Organizations should prioritize patching, incident response readiness, and user education against scams and phishing in the coming days.
